page.title: 20M.A.L.F. Pitt-Rivers Esq. ii
page.content: He does get money from the Government to help him in his conservation pro- gramme, and so special broad-leaved trees are planted so that plants may grow in the dappled shade. Insects breed which helps bird life. This is called symbiosis. He thinks that in a hundred years' time will be known, not for farming, but as one of special scientific intrest. He thinks owning land is very unprof- itable these days and so he has bought land in{Australia at Perth}on which factories are built for{Japanese busi- {nessmen. The house is extremely beautiful in both the interior and exterior and with its garden, surrounding woodland and chalk down and valleys, it must be considered one of the most beautiful spots in England { (AUTHORS: )
